Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (11/9/2011 10:02:58 PM)

posts.post_content:
Flavorful to the core, gamebreaking when used in the right deck, a deck-enabler in essence, this card has everything you want from a card.  
  
Don't forget that Dragonstorm was one of the best deck during Time Spiral-legal Standard, powered by mana-gainers like [Rite of Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Flame), [Seething Song](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seething Song) and [Lotus Bloom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Bloom), cheap library manipulation ala [Telling Time](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Telling Time) (love this card!), [Sleight of Hand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sleight of Hand), and [Mishra's Bauble](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mishra's Bauble), and dirty tricks like Gigadrowse. It was really one hell of a deck!
posts.html:
Flavorful to the core, gamebreaking when used in the right deck, a deck-enabler in essence, this card has everything you want from a card.

Don't forget that Dragonstorm was one of the best deck during Time Spiral-legal Standard, powered by mana-gainers like Rite of Flame, Seething Song and Lotus Bloom, cheap library manipulation ala Telling Time (love this card!), Sleight of Hand, and Mishra's Bauble, and dirty tricks like Gigadrowse. It was really one hell of a deck!

posts.post_content: @darkfury: I'm sorry to say, but it says put into play, and not cast. Therefore, you would only get a total of 11 dragons (sad, I know), and you could only grab 4 [Bogardan Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bogardan Hellkite)s, 4 [Kokusho, the Evening Star](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kokusho, the Evening Star)s, 3 [Broodmate Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Broodmate Dragon)s, and a partridge in a pear tree, thereby dealing 40 damage to an opponent, getting 11 dragons out, and, just for kicks, throwing a tree at them. Hell, with the pounding they'd get, they might not even notice the pretty little bird. Ungrateful bastards.

posts.post_content:
**Aaron’s Random Card Comment of the Day #12, 10/12/10**   
   
Twelve days into Random Card Comments, and the closest I’ve come to a top-tier constructed card was [Merfolk of the Pearl Trident](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merfolk of the Pearl Trident)… that is, until this little number.
  
   
The first time Dragonstorm appeared was in the *Scourge* set, which it essentially epitomized all by itself. After all, the two big talking points of that set were Dragons and the storm mechanic, and this card neatly combines the two. (It actually epitomizes its designer, Brian Tinsman, as well. Brian is a fan of boundary-pushing mechanics and giant monsters.) When considering which storm card to reprint in the timeshifted set of *Time Spiral*, Dragonstorm was the natural choice, both because it was such a poster child for *Scourge* and because it was one of the few storm cards that hadn’t been broken in half yet. A few good “rituals” and one [Bogardan Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bogardan Hellkite) later (also a Tinsman design), and what do ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Twelve days into Random Card Comments, and the closest I’ve come to a top-tier constructed card was Merfolk of the Pearl Trident… that is, until this little number.

The first time Dragonstorm appeared was in the Scourge set, which it essentially epitomized all by itself. After all, the two big talking points of that set were Dragons and the storm mechanic, and this card neatly combines the two. (It actually epitomizes its designer, Brian Tinsman, as well. Brian is a fan of boundary-pushing mechanics and giant monsters.) When considering which storm card to reprint in the timeshifted set of Time Spiral, Dragonstorm was the natural choice, both because it was such a poster child for Scourge and because it was one of the few storm cards that hadn’t been broken in half yet. A few good “rituals” and one Bogardan Hellkite later (also a Tinsman design), and what do ... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Mountain + Rite of Flame + Rite of Flame + Rite of Flame + Rite of Flame + Grapeshot + Dragonstorm
  
5 devidable damage and 6 Dragons in play by turn 1 (and an empty hand).
  
Like DarkbladeWraith said: "not the most likliest of draws ever, but this is cold hard powergaming - little things like Statistics won't get in our way! =D"
  
Using Desperate Ritua and Seething Song also helps
